originalText.text:
I am just ao hurt for my son. He was so excited to get away. Had his bags packed since June. After testing everyone. Not even 24 hours later there is a covid outbreak. Not 1 case an out break amongst the staff. Really? Don't do that to chikdren it's not like they going to Disney world or something. This was just cruel.  1 why would you test again within 24 hours. 2) why couldn't you test everyone and send positive cases home.  They just snatched these kids only get away from them. I fi d this so hard to believe. I'm just thinking about my baby crying
Wow it was cruel really really cruel.

originalText.text: I was a camper here it wasn't great but it wasn't bad there was this camper who purposely peed on another's camper bed because we was scrunching his toes although staff is nice once you get to know them

originalText.text: THEY DO NOT CONTACT FAMILIES WHEN CHILDREN ARE INJURED ON THEIR CAMP SITE. THE CAMPERS FAMILY WAS CONTACTED THE NEXT DAY FOLLOWING THE INJURY, WHICH WAS ONLY AFTER CAMPER BEGGED STAFF TO MAKE THE CALL. CAMPER REMAINED WITH NO MEDICAL CARE FOR 14+ HOURS AND HAD NO ASSISTANCE COMPLETING TASKS FOLLOWING THEIR INJURY.

originalText.text:
I feel this program really is geared for the underprivileged child unexposed to travel and opportunities. I was looking forward to all the benefits of The Fresh Air Fund such as the tutoring, SAT prep, college readiness and the many other support options. But Fresh Air mandates a two-week sleep away camp as a qualifier into the program that just was not for my child. There is no phone communication allowed, only letters, and you're lucky to receive two before the two weeks are up.

Our close knit family traveled often and was accustomed to communications via phone, text and emails. So my child had severe separation anxiety once he got to the camp. He had camp mates that, when left unsupervised, weren't very kind and initiated physical altercations. He wrote home begging us to come get him while also writing that he had tried to be brave and not cry but he really missed us and wanted to come home. My husband drove up the same day we received that letter and my son broke down in tears when they brought him out to us. And because he did not complete the entire two weeks he was disqualified from the program altogether.

The Fresh Air Fund has a one-style-fits-all structure for its program but it's  not ideal for anxious children. To know at a designated time they can check in with a parent makes a significant impact on a child with separation anxiety. It can give them the emotional support they need to complete the two-week requirement and feel successful that they completed such a necessary step in the program.

Thankfully I found a program with a similar sleep-away requirement that allowed any interested campers 15 minute nightly video chats or phone calls and it made a huge difference for my family. My son relished in showing me his camp, his campmates, and sharing the day's activities. I saw how happy he was and was glad he allowed me to enroll him in another program because he was very mistrustful of camps after his Fresh Air Fund experience.

This is not to say The Fresh Air Fund won't work for your extroverted and outgoing child, but parents should know how this may affect children who need extra support.

originalText.text: Well I go to Camp Hidden Valley it’s amazing I’ve been going since I was 8 I’m now 12 I can’t imagine any better way to spend 2 weeks of my summer. I enjoy the pool and I always have the best staff and my cabin is always amazing. If you are worried about bullying or if your child has a disability don’t Hidden Valley is a camp that accepts Disability children and non disability children. They interact with each other and make friends. This past summer I met this girl name Joanna and she was a really good friend to me. If you ever think about What camp to send your child to Hidden Valley is definitely the camp
